raw_text:
Robben plays down European return
 
 Injured Chelsea winger Arjen Robben has insisted that he only has a 10% chance of making a return against Barcelona in the Champions League.
 
 The 21-year-old has been sidelined since breaking a foot against Blackburn last month. Chelsea face Barcelona at home on 8 March having lost 2-1 in the first leg. And Robben told the Daily Star: "It is not impossible that I will play against Barcelona but it is just a very, very small chance - about 10%."
 
 Robben has been an inspirational player for Chelsea this season following a switch from PSV Einhoven last summer. He added: "My recovery is going better than we expected a few weeks ago but I think the Barcelona game will come too soon. "I won't take any risks and come back too soon."
llama3.2:1b: Arjen Robben says he has only 10% chance of playing in Chelsea's Champions League match against Barcelona due to injury. He also stated that his recovery is going better than expected, but thinks the game will not be played until later.
llama3.2:3b: Arjen Robben says he has only a 10% chance of returning for Chelsea's match against Barcelona on March 8 due to his ongoing injury recovery.
gemma2:2b: Arjen Robben has a 10% chance of playing against Barcelona in the Champions League. He recently broke his foot and is recovering well, but he doesn't believe he'll be ready for the match on March 8th.  He will not take any risks to return before he's fully recovered.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Chelsea winger Arjen Robben insists his return to European football will be limited, with a 10% chance of making a Champions League debut at home against Barcelona on 8 March. He has been sidelined since breaking a foot in December last year, but is recovering and confident he can play.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Arjen Robben, 21, has a 10% chance of returning for Chelsea vs. Barcelona in the Champions League due to injury; his recovery is improving but he fears it could be too soon.
qwen2.5:3b: Robben, sidelined since breaking a foot against Blackburn, has stated he only has a 10% chance of returning to play for Chelsea in their Champions League match against Barcelona on March 8th. He was previously an inspirational player at Chelsea following his summer move from PSV Einhoven. Robben's recovery is progressing but he emphasizes caution not to risk injuring himself further by rushing back too soon.

His recovery is going better than we expected a few weeks ago but he thinks the Barcelona game will come too soon." He added: "My recovery is going better than we expected and he won't take any risks and come back too soon."
smollm:1.7b: Robben's statement about his chances of making a return against Barcelona in the Champions League is concise, conveying the key idea that he has only a 10% chance of playing for his country. The text does not provide additional information or explanations to support this claim.

Arjen Robben, an injured Chelsea winger, has announced that he only has a 10% chance of returning against Barcelona in the Champions League, according to The Daily Star. He was sidelined since breaking a foot against Blackburn last month. Chelsea and Barcelona will face each other at home on March 8 after a 2-1 loss. Robben emphasized his recovery is improving but also mentioned that the game with Barcelona may come too soon, and he won't take any risks returning too soon.
tinyllama:1.1b: Injured Chelsea winger Arjen Robben has stated that he only has a 10% chance of making a return against Barcelona in the Champions League. The 21-year-old has been sidelined since breaking his foot during Blackburn's match last month and is currently recovering from an ankle injury. However, Robben has not ruled out a return to action for Chelsea, noting that the "small" chance of playing against Barcelona is just about 10%. Despite this, Robben expressed his desire to face the Catalan giants once more, stating that he will only take risks when recovering from his injuries.

Despite recovering relatively well from his injury, Robben has expressed that he won't take any risks and will not play until the match is closer to his recovery date.
